page.title: 01Trondavoe & Scatsta Airfield
page.content: The B9076 road bisects this 3 X 4km block and runs from the south west to the north east of the area following a shallow valley. West of the road are three hills, Fraw Houll, South Ward and North Ward. The latter being the highest at 82m. The block is mainly grazed by sheep although the waters of Sullom Voe are at the western edge of the block. To the south east of the road the land rises steeply to a point of 180m at the hill of Trondavoe. There are scattered dwellings along the route of the road which is built to a high standard to carry the heavy traffic en route to Sullom Voe oil terminal. The most significant feature in this block is Scatsta Airfield which was re-built and modernised in 1978 and provides an essential service to people commuting
